meanings.definition: To beat with a birch rod as a form of punishment.
meanings.sent1: The strict teacher birched the naughty student for misbehaving.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, children were often birched in schools for breaking the rules.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy thought it was funny when it got birched on its tail.
meanings.sent4: The wind birched the leaves off the trees, creating a beautiful autumn scene.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the birched rod striking echoed through the classroom, making everyone cringe.
